title: [$250] Submit query lingers on other member when switching accounts via copilot

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.32-1 **Reproducible in staging?:** Y **Reproducible in production?:** Y **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** **Issue reported by:** @trjExpensify **Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#Expensify Bugs ](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM/p1760551509709109) ## Action Performed: 1. Set up accountB as a copilot 2. Go to Reports > Submit 3. Go to Settings > switch to accountB 4. Click the Reports page tab 5. Observe the from: in the query doesn’t update 6. Click on the Reports suggested search > then click on Submit suggested search 7. Observe the from: in the query updates ## Expected Result: When switching to another account via Copilot, the query filters (e.g., from:) should automatically update to reflect the newly active account immediately upon switching — without needing to reselect the search. ## Actual Result: After switching accounts, the “Submit” query lingers with the previous account’s filter until a manual interaction (reselecting the search) occurs. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop
Platforms Tested: On which of our officially supported platforms was this issue tested: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop
## Screenshots/Videos

title: [$250] Add bank account - User not prompted to change currency after account validation

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.32-0-staging **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/72572 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** N/A **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Windows 11, Chrome | Samsung A15, Android 15 **App Component:** Workspace Settings ## Action Performed: 1. Go to https://staging.new.expensify.com/ 2. Sign up with a Gmail address that includes a + 3. Choose Track and budget expenses. Complete the onboarding flow. 4. Create a workspace. 5. Go to more features, toggle on Invoices 6. Go to Invoices 7. Click on Add bank account ## Expected Result: After validating the bank account, the user should be prompted to change the account currency. ## Actual Result: No prompt appears to change or confirm the currency after account validation. Additionally, the flow for adding a bank account after validation looks like to Wallet > Add bank account flow, which displays the “Personal bank account added” screen upon completion. However, if the user cancels the add bank account flow after validation and reopens it, the add bank account flow now looks like Workflows > Add bank account and the “Personal bank account added” screen is not shown at the end of the process. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [x] iOS: mWeb Safari - [x] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/793ff55b-9158-4dce-b81e-f68802ac20dc [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.32-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/70283 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** sjidnojoidjiojdsd@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Mac 15.5 / Chrome **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: Precondition: - Workspace has at least two members. 1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com 2. Go to workspace chat. 3. Create an expense in workspace chat. 4. Open expense report. 5. Click Submit. 6. Click More > Change approver. 7. Select Add approver > Change approver. 8. Upgrade workspace if prompted > Change approver. 9. Select a user > Save. 10. Click Report. 11. Click Remove from report. ## Expected Result: The expense will be removed successfully. ## Actual Result: The removed expense reappears in the report. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [x] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/7c3dbb9c-4ee4-46df-8a81-8d79144dcac4 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.31-2 **Reproducible in staging?:** Y **Reproducible in production?:** Y **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** **Issue reported by:** @Christinadobrzyn **Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#Expensify Bugs](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM/p1760545302398019) ## Action Performed: 1. Sign into New Expensify (ND) on the Desktop app 2. Open a chat where someone has sent a PDF or image attachment 3. Click to open the PDF/image preview 4. Try to drag/move the app window while the preview is open ## Expected Result: The user should be able to move the ND desktop app window even when an image or PDF preview is open ## Actual Result: When an image or PDF is open, the window becomes fixed in place — the user cannot move it until they close the preview. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [x] MacOS: Desktop

title: [$250] LHN - Archived #Admins room remains on LHN with GBR if it has pending request to join workspace

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.31-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-1291/folder/13176686/41236627/952580720 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** ibellicotest+1926@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Motorola MotoG60 / Android 12 / Chrome ( mWeb / Hybrid app) - Windows 11 / Chrome **App Component:** Left Hand Navigation (LHN) ## Action Performed: Prerequisite: User A, has at least one workspace. Prerequisite 2: Have two accounts opened on two different devices or environments. 1. Open the Expensify app. 2. Navigate to "Workspaces" and open any workspace. 3. Tap on "Overview" 4. Tap on "More" and select "Share" 5. Copy the URL of the workspace. 6. Start a new chat with User B. 7. Paste the just copied URL. 8. As User B, navigate to the just received URL. 9. As User A, navigate to #Admins room. 10. Note that a request from User B, to join the workspace, was received. 11. Without accepting or declining the request, navigate to "Workspaces" and delete the workspace. 12. Return to LHN. 13. Note that #Admins room is still displayed on LHN with an "Archived" label and GBR. ## Expected Result: #Admins room should disappear from LHN after the workspace is deleted. ## Actual Result: Archived #Admins room, remains on LHN with GBR if it contains a pending request to join the workspace. Request is no longer visible on chat, but room still remains on LHN and user can´t make it disappear. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/538fa1c5-b735-4841-aca9-d90ee2ffaedd [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)
